page.title: 19Use of crops from Cardington
page.content:
The beef herd are bought as bullocks and kept for 18 months. During the winter they are fed on baled silage. There is only one herd in this block.
The peas are sent to be "mushy peas" or animal feed. The potatoes grown are a mixture of second early and main crop. They are sold to caterers and fast food shops for use as chips. The brussell sprouts are sold for freezing or to be prepacked for the large retail food chains. The onions are grown to give a supply for the market throughout the year.
Winter wheat is grown as animal feed and Oil Seed Rape is grown for food and industrial companies.
